name: Pus
body:
### Contributors Laura Asoltanei (@LauraAsoltanei) and Andrei-Bogdan Baran (@andreibaran) ### Request Personalized user interfaces consider the user preferences, social profile, emotional state, and (existing or not) disabilities/medical conditions. This user specific data is often processed in conjunction to different environmental data, usually modeled via rules â€“ for example, increasing/decreasing the screen brightness depends on the sunlight or go to voicemail if it is too cold to get the phone out. In addition, other significant data could be considered: pollution, various natural hazards like earthquakes, and others. Propose a multi-device UI framework/application that takes advantage of both user preferences (including anatomical characteristics, psychological profile, or health status), context (place or season) and/or device (TV, mobile device, home appliance, smart car), etc. ### Technical requirements * Minimum 3 ideas/concepts regarding the project design (including the sketches, wireframes, storyboards and, eventually, prototypes), plus the intermediary stages of the project development. Also, the team should provide the documentation regarding interaction design patterns used in the wireframes/prototypes. * Minimum 3 real examples concerning the QOC method. These examples could also give the motivation for choosing a certain idea/concept. * The 4 mandatory HTML5 persona documents. * The project identity and the most significant details regarding the branding process. * A public blog, wiki and/or personal Web site recording the project progress. The use of GitHub platform is highly encouraged. ### Personas ![primary](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LauraAsoltanei/PUS/gh-pages/images/primary.png) ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LauraAsoltanei/PUS/gh-pages/design/wireframes/version2/12980400_1144724638911894_1111565199_n.jpg) ###QOC's Q: How can an user create an account?
O: He can either provide an username or a password or he can login using Facebook
C: Simplicity, efficency, time saving
Q: How could the supervised persons be displayed?
O: Within a section from the menu, using separate fields that are permanently visible, from a dedicated page
C: Fast access
Q: Where should the menu be placed?
O: On top of the page near logo, on the left of the page in a column, in a mobile-like application list
C: Easy to reach, good fitting with the other components
Q: What sections should the footer contain?
O: "About Us", "Countact Us", "FAQ's", "Find Us on Facebook", "Statistics", the logo
C: Utility, space fitting
Q: What are the visual elements that should be found within the mobile application?
O: The input field for the registration code, details about the application, the logo, the "Save" button, link to the application's website
C: Efficency, elegance, simplicity
Q: What data could the user request from the supervised person's phone?
O: Location, temperature, acceleration, environment brightness
C: Accuracy, feeling of having the things under control
Q: How could the user request a further information about the supervised person?
O: By using checkboxes, comboboxes, clickable listboxes
C: Efficency, intuitive usage
Q: How could the notifications be displayed?
O: Into a list in a dedicated page, into a box that would appear when the mouse goes over the notifications button, into a popup
C: Clarity, visibility
Q: What settings should a user have access to?
O: Setting regarding the security of the communication with the device, profile settings, notification settings, design and structure settings
C: Customizability, feeling of control, usability
Q: What kind of elementes could be used in order to create the identity of the application?
O: Logo, motto, colors, topography
C: Style, identity
